title: Notifications: why less is more — how Facebook has been increasing both user satisfaction and app usage by sending only a few notifications

last_post.content:
Facebook discovers that if you bug people incessantly you increase short-term results by sacrificing in the long-term.

The opposite is also true. If you focus on communicating more selectively with value, you see worse results initially BUT end up in a stronger, more sustainable position.

Reminds you of choices we make in fundraising?

Loyalty wins.

(Also confirms my pet theory that for-profits are becoming more and more like nonprofits. :-)

#longterm #fundraising

Guy Inchbald shared something interesting with me. The Weaire-Phelan foam is a relaxation of a packing of irregular dodecahedra and tetrakaidecahedra. Dissect the dodecahedra into pentagon-based pyramids by adding a vertex at the center, then glue their bases to the surrounding tetrakaidecahedra. Amazingly the faces line up and the result is a decahedron that tiles space by itself.

Guy's page about Weaire-Phelan: https://steelpillow.com/polyhedra/wp/wp.html

title: GitHub - rougier/book-mode: A clean interface for org files (Emacs)

last_post.content: #emacs Book mode is an attempt at offering an interface for reading org-mode files with a clean layout. It is based on the use of large margins, headline and mode-line, with leading stars and bullets in the left margin using right alignment and different symbols. All decorations are part of the header-line (including upper left colored part and right upper glyph) and messages are displayed in the mode-line. Code at https://github.com/rougier/book-mode

title: Is the fediverse about to get Fryed? (Or, “Why every toot is also a potential denial of service attack”)

last_post.content:
Interesting details from @aral on how expensive and computationally intense Mastodon can be.

https://ar.al/2022/11/09/is-the-fediverse-about-to-get-fryed-or-why-every-toot-is-also-a-potential-denial-of-service-attack/

At the time, he had 22k followers. Every post he made, and each reply, kicks off ~3k Sidekiq jobs.

He's on a totally self-hosted server with just him. A €20/month plan won't cut it, nor will a €50/month plan.

Pricey pricey.

The Chronocyclegraph was developed by Frank Gilbreth and his wife, Lillian in the early 20th century. The couple employed small lamps on worker's hands and time-lapse photography to reduce a work cycle to the most efficient sequence. Gilbreth was the first to propose that a nurse could assist the surgeon, by handing them surgical instruments. He also devised the techniques used to teach how to rapidly disassemble and reassemble weapons.

title: Double Dosing Levonorgestrel-Based Emergency Contraception for Individuals With Obesity: A Randomized Controlled Trial - PubMed

last_post.content: This was disappointing. Lower efficacy of Plan B (levonogestrel) in people with larger bodies can’t be overcome with a higher dose. This study found doubling the dose had no impact on preventing ovulation. Ella (ulipristal acetate) remains the best option for these folks (and everyone really) but unfortunately requires a prescription. #MedMastodon https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/35849455/
